title: schnoffi
author: schnoffi
content: Hi folks I need to lend 0.35BTC or 120LTC for approx 6 Weeks with an interest of 10-15% -if this is possible for someoneI'm in a serious problem. My house  (for me and 2 Kids)was burned down 2 weeks ago and I need this amount to make the important repairs.I have the first small money back from insurance and the rest is on the way within in the next weeks - but I need it very urgent.bc1qcsyyz29dhgzwyjugfcydzaerxtyfhcd356tza4for BTCLP69ctfUFFw9JAipPW6H5mL1TofCtoWEABfor LTCBest wishes

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: No one will lend you even a penny without valid collateral. Nobody here knows you, so why should anyone trust you?

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 08:58:31 AMHi folks I need to lend 0.35BTC or 120LTC for approx 6 Weeks with an interest of 10-15% -if this is possible for someoneHow stupid you are? How even you thought someone will give you $10,220 without knowing anything about you?QuoteI'm in a serious problem. My house  (for me and 2 Kids)was burned down 2 weeks ago and I need this amount to make the important repairs.I have the first small money back from insurance and the rest is on the way within in the next weeks - but I need it very urgent.Even if it is true, there will be no one who will risk $10,000 to a stranger. Go to the local bank or wait for the insurance to pay you. Don't you know anyone in real life? Like don't you have a brother, sister, uncle, cousins or even a good neighbor?

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 08:58:31 AMI'm in a serious problem. My house  (for me and 2 Kids)was burned down 2 weeks ago and I need this amount to make the important repairs.It's unfortunate if this is true, but nobody is going to get you that much or even 0.00003 BTC. You got an issue, what made you think that you would just register into the forum and through your brand-new throw away account, you would secure a loan without valid collateral within a day?

comments.author: schnoffi
comments.body: Yes sound crazy - no I'm reading a longer time here...Normally is my side business to create colourful pictures in Set-Top boxes. Crypto and how to identify and hack is also side business  since 2 weeks.....I have focus more on that. according to my situation.My business is trading..

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 01:48:09 PMYes sound crazyThat's the first thing you've written on this forum that makes sense.  The post below (which you've now deleted) makes absolutely no sense.  If you're in a financial pickle, why are you spending money on fake wallet files?  If you've been reading here for any time, you must know these are all scams.  And I must admit, the timing smells fishy.  Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 07:14:17 AMHi guys does it make sense to ask for a Password from a small wallet?I've started to find it - but I need more experience for that....much moreit's an BTC 1,2 that I boughtwe can split if someone help me.https://ninjastic.space/post/62612576If your story is true, then I'm sorry for you.  But, you're not going to get a penny for a sob-story.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: iwantmyhomepaidwithbtc2 on July 28, 2023, 11:32:18 AMNo one will lend you even a penny without valid collateral. Who told you that type of stupid method? My fund, My decision. I have accepted the loan request and sent fund to the requested wallet. Transaction ID:bc1qcsyyz29dhgzwyjugfcydzaerxtyfhcd356tza4@Op please repay on or before the due date to LP69ctfUFFw9JAipPW6H5mL1TofCtoWEAB

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Even with serious reasons, there are no lenders who would risk their money on a newbie. Actually, even if you are a legendary member in the forum, I still doubt someone would lend you money without collateral. So my advice is to look for assistance elsewhere if you really need serious help.

comments.author: schnoffi
comments.body: @DireWolfM14 - I haven't written that I have paid for that.btw - I hope that you will never come in a situation like me. Never mind I can understand what and why you comment this. My first thoughts would be the same.

comments.author: CYBER_COWBOY
comments.created_time: July 28, 2023, 03:25:37 PMLast edit: July 28, 2023, 04:01:36 PM by CYBER_COWBOY
comments.body: Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 08:58:31 AMI'm in a serious problem. My house  (for me and 2 Kids)was burned down 2 weeks ago and I need this amount to make the important repairs.I have the first small money back from insurance and the rest is on the way within in the next weeks - but I need it very urgent.Why do you need it very urgent?I am a house owner in three different countries and a serious repair company would never ask for money in advance ever in any country.If your story is true which I highly doubt, you are hiring a scam repair company and should change ASAP.EDIT: Maybe you are the same person that coming here with new accounts every week and think "This time I have such a good story so they will give me money". If so.. How many attempts have you tried now?Please stop. Spend all this time on find a job or do some work instead, I think it so strange that new people comming here like 1-3 times every week with an amazing story, why just here? Maybe this forum is very famous, what do I know.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Well, these are these curious stories that we see around here, in which I think that the person who asks for the loan does it like someone who buys a lottery ticket, the probability that you win is 0 by mathematical approximation, but it doesn't cost you much effort or time to write a shitty post asking for the money. As CYBER_COWBOY says, you can give the repair company the advance that the insurance has given you, let them go to work and when the rest of the insurance money arrives, pay them the rest. The company is not going to ask for everything in advance. And even you needed the money so urgently, it would be more logical for you to get the money from your bank.Anyway, in these cases, the simplest explanation is the real one, and that is that it is a crude attempt to keep $10K and not show up here again.

comments.body: Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 03:19:27 PMI haven't written that I have paid for that.Well then, your deleted post is confusing me.  What was it that you bought?Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 03:19:27 PMbtw - I hope that you will never come in a situation like me.That makes two of us, regardless of whether you're telling the truth or not.  But there's something funny about the way you type, you don't sound like a Mexican.Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 03:19:27 PMNever mind I can understand what and why you comment this. My first thoughts would be the same.Then I suggest you lock this thread.  There's a link to do so at the bottom left of this page.

My first thoughts would be the same.Then I suggest you lock this thread.  There's a link to do so at the bottom left of this page.Lol, I watch a lot of Mexican videos where someone pays a taco stand to offer free tacos the next hour.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: @OP, I would ask this of you;Would you have loaned just anyone over the web because his got some house problems?My answer to that and to your thread is a loud NO. Nobody does that and you wouldn’t find such aid from this forum either with, a none reputable account that has got no history to it.You might want to know this that, the forum isn’t some place you just come for your gains, it’s firstly a discussion platform and that aids you in knowledge grabbing and you in turn gets to update on what is available. Don’t be all money seeking out here, these are treasured values of outmost importance to one who ones them.People get tagged for this sort of thread and so, you might want to lock it before that happens and you wouldn’t find any luck here.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Please post a video of yourself in front of your burnt down house writingCode:Aw9#8+ExG8"^mkriNcAJ

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: schnoffi on July 28, 2023, 01:48:09 PMYes sound crazy - no I'm reading a longer time here...Normally is my side business to create colourful pictures in Set-Top boxes. Crypto and how to identify and hack is also side business  since 2 weeks.....I have focus more on that. according to my situation.My business is trading..I hope you have some assets which you can put up for collateral like jewelry, (apple products?) or something like that, whatever collateral you come up with will have to be stored with an escrow that is trusted by both you and the lender here, so could be a 3rd party service or another Bitcointalk user. Either way, much safer than dealing with something like a pawn shop (I heard they resort to violence if you fail to pay the loan in a timely matter).Quote from: Timelord2067 on August 01, 2023, 12:32:11 AMPlease post a video of yourself in front of your burnt down house writingCode:Aw9#8+ExG8"^mkriNcAJThat's a privacy infraction. Why should they have to do that?

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on August 01, 2023, 08:32:49 AMThat's a privacy infraction. Why should they have to do that?I.D. can be faked.One photo of a burned house is no different to any other photo and does not prove a residential address.A randomly generated series of twenty letters, numbers and characters prevents any fake prepared videos crafted days, weeks or months in advance.OP talks about insurance so it would ensure there is no insurance fraudA lender is entitled to know who the borrower is and the truthfulness of their "genuine reason" for a loan given the potential borrower didn't just say it was for "personal" reasons.If the potential borrower can't truthfully prove the circumstances of the claims in their loan application, then that would mean they are not being truthful.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on August 01, 2023, 08:32:49 AMQuote from: Timelord2067 on August 01, 2023, 12:32:11 AMPlease post a video of yourself in front of your burnt down house writingCode:Aw9#8+ExG8"^mkriNcAJThat's a privacy infraction. Why should they have to do that?Of course, it was sarcasm. Or was it for real? Timelord? He already knows that the person is lying. There is no way he can do this.Even if he can do it, Timelord is not guaranteed to lend him a penny without valid collateral.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: Learn Bitcoin on August 02, 2023, 04:02:49 AMOf course, it was sarcasm. Or was it for real? Timelord? He already knows that the person is lying. There is no way he can do this.Even if he can do it, Timelord is not guaranteed to lend him a penny without valid collateral. Yeah, and that doesn't prove anything either. I hope that was sarcasm. Because at the end of my street there's an old house that's been burnt down, you can still see the fire damages. I could go in front of it and write down "Aw9#8+ExG8"^mkriNcAJ" on video, would that justify sending me 0.3 BTC?

comments.author: God Of Thunder

He already knows that the person is lying. There is no way he can do this.Even if he can do it, Timelord is not guaranteed to lend him a penny without valid collateral. Yeah, and that doesn't prove anything either. I hope that was sarcasm. Because at the end of my street there's an old house that's been burnt down, you can still see the fire damages. I could go in front of it and write down "Aw9#8+ExG8"^mkriNcAJ" on video, would that justify sending me 0.3 BTC?Nope. Not at all. He did not say that anywhere in his post.Obviously, it was a touch of sarcasm, and he wanted to troll OP, and that's it. No reason to take it seriously.
